meanings.definition: A person who is uncultured or unsophisticated.
meanings.sent1: The ockers at the party were loud and rude.
meanings.sent2: She always avoided the ockers in her neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The ockers tried to impress everyone with their bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with ockers, oblivious to the beauty around them.
meanings.sent5: The ockers' lack of manners was evident to all who met them.

meanings.definition: To behave in a loud, brash, or uncouth manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't ockers during the performance.
meanings.sent2: He tends to ockers whenever he gets excited.
meanings.sent3: The children ockers around the playground, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The protesters ockers outside the government building, demanding change.
meanings.sent5: The animals in the zoo started to ockers when the visitors got too close.
